intro: Isocoma pluriflora, commonly known as the many-flowered goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has alternate, oblanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Isocoma pluriflora is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
